title: Commission Regulation (EEC) No 28/90 of 4 January 1990 concerning the classification of certain goods in the codes 1108 11 00, 1108 12 00, 1108 13 00 and 1108 14 00 of the combined nomenclature and repealing Regulation (EEC) No 1463/87
header:
6.1.1990 EN Official Journal of the European Communities L 3/9
COMMISSION REGULATION (EEC) No 28/90
of 4 January 1990
concerning the classification of certain goods in the codes 1108 11 00, 1108 12 00, 1108 13 00 and 1108 14 00 of the combined nomenclature and repealing Regulation (EEC) No 1463/87
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body: The goods described in column 1 of the annexed table are now classified within the combined nomenclature under the appropriate CN codes indicated in column 2 of the table.

This Regulation shall enter into force on 1 March 1990.
This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 4 January 1990.
For the Commission
Christiane SCRIVENER
Member of the Commission
(1)  OJ No L 256, 7. 9. 1987, p. 1.
(2)  OJ No L 374, 22. 12. 1989, p. 2.
(3)  OJ No L 138, 28. 5. 1987, p. 36.
ANNEX
Description of the goods CN code Reasons
(1) (2) (3)
1. Products in the form of fine, white powder consisting of:
— starch content (determined by the Ewers method): 95 % or more by weight on the dry product,
— acetyl content (determined by the enzymatic method): less than 0,5 % by weight on the dry product
2. Products in the form of fine, white powder consisting of:
— starch content (determined by the Ewers method): 95 % or more by weight on the dry product,
— acetyl content (determined by the enzymatic method): less than 0,5 % by weight on the dry product
3. Products in the form of fine, white powder consisting of:
— starch content (determined by the Ewers method): 95 % or more by weight on the dry product,
— acetyl content (determined by the enzymatic method): less than 0,5 % by weight on the dry product
4. Products in the form of fine, white powder consisting of:
— starch content (determined by the Ewers method): 95 % or more by weight on the dry product,
— acetyl content (determined by the enzymatic method): less than 0,5 % by weight on the dry product
